metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28879 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.52.0, the Zip implementation canreport an incorrect size due to an integer overflow. This bug can lead to abuffer overflow when a consumed Zip iterator is used again.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28879` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.53 - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-all - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-clippy - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-gdb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-lldb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rust-src - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rustc - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
rustfmt - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1~20.04.1').
